page.title: 20JAMES LEATHER, FARMER.
page.content: Mr. Leather's father was an accountant in Ilkley but he allowed his son to train at college to be a farmer. Then he was a pupil for 2 years then the war. He came to this village in l948 and bought a farm of 200 acres,split up in parcels of land by water supply. He had 50 cows,Ayrshires,Shorthorns and Guernseys milked by 6 men. Now he has 150 Friesian cows and one cowman and 600 acres. It used to take 4 hours to milk. They started aat 5 oclock in the morning. Now 1 and a half. He grew grass, wheat, oats, kale and potatoes. Barley, which he grows now, used to be _thought to give high blood pressure to cows. The milk goes by tanker to Doncaster. The potatoes to feed chickens, the barley for his cow feed. MR. Leather is Anna and Kate's Grandpa. He is a Parish and District Councillor for this district.
